name: Culag Lochside Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Culag Lochside guest house for just one night on our holiday in Scotland. We were extremely fortunate to have gorgeous weather for our stay which really enhances the experience of staying right on Loch Lomond. The guest house is about 20 - 30 minutes walk along the loch to Luss where we had a lovely, great - value meal with excellent service at the Village Rest. We returned to the Village Rest on our return journey for lunch and again were not left disappointed. Our room at Culag was in the main house and was clean and comfortable with fantastic views down the loch to see the sea planes take off and arrive. We had a sitting area in our room with a sofa etc. which was very comfortable. Breakfast was good with lots of choice and Patrick is a great host.
reviews.title: Excellent stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Culag Lochside B&B is right on the loch edge, with sea plane flights going from the same location. The location is stunning and very picturesque with only metres to walk to the actual loch side.
reviews.title: Picturesque B&B in a tranquil location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Most of the rooms are in converted barns and are of a good size. Breakfasts are good and plentiful.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Patrick took the time to pick my mother up at Glasgow airport. He waited over an hour for her as she had lost her luggage.
reviews.title: Its all about the Views!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were staying a bit further away with a wedding party, and I was so happy Mom had elected to stay at Culag.
reviews.title: Perfect place to get away from it all, friendly owners and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Best B & B witohut doubt, that we have stayed in. Very clean and well situatied. First Class breakfast. Only stayed 2 nights. Would stay for longer for a relaxing break in a beautiful location. Patrick very helpful. Even gave us a lift to the restaurant . Five stars from us.
reviews.title: STUNNING LOCATION AND GREAT HOSPITALITY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at Culag one night this August 2010 (payed 70 pounds cash for a double room) and all I can say about it is good. Outstanding atmosphere and location just in the shore of Loch Lomond, very close to Luss village. Our bedroom had everything one could expect and more, including DVD's to watch! Patrick, the host, makes you feel like at home. I'm sure Culag will be your best choice for overnight in Loch Lomond's area.
reviews.title: Simply the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our fifth stay each time it gets better! Patric the perfect host welcomed us, the room was immaculate and well stocked with essentials (corkscrew & glasses). Since our last visit a tasteful BBQ area has been added and beautifully landscaped.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was great, newspapers provided and a wide choice including fruit and omelettes! Fantastic views to Loch Lomond.
reviews.title: Culag (Patrics paradise)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010
reviews.text: This is without doubt the best B & B we have ever found. The location is amazing,the design that Patric has put in to this little paradise is wonderfull. After a small mix up about rooms at the start of our stay the hospitality was overwhelming,we even stayed an extra night,that was after being given a guided tour of this lovely estate.The owner even has similar tastes in sport and cultural music as we have,he also loaned me some of his own cd's from his car just to make us feel at home.
reviews.title: Stunning lochside accommodation with...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first night in Scotland on a 6 night trip and this B&B was wonderful. Very comfortable rooms with every facility for a longer stay, even a fridge and toaster. This is in a beautiful setting right on the loch side and the breakfast was superb. Patric was very welcoming and helpful. Just sorry we hadn’t planned on staying longer. We ate in the Village Rest in Luss and even stopped there on our way back to Glasgow for lunch a few days later - excellent choice, food and service.
reviews.title: Will certainly come back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife, 2 yr old daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights in Aug/Sep. The place is beautifully situated on the lough shore; yes there is traffic nearby, but this didn't detract from our experience. Patrick was friendly and very helpful, rooms were fine, breakfast good and overall we had a great time.
reviews.title: Great location and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this guest house was fantastic. We were travelling with a large German Shepherd Dog so were surprised he was allowed in! We were given one of the special rooms reserved for dogs, which opened out straight onto the lawns. The room was clean with plenty of space.
reviews.title: Stunning location, excellent guest house, great for the dog!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was great, the owners were lovely and the dog particularly enjoyed the sausage that the owner saved especially for him!
reviews.title: Difficult to find anything unsatisfactory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Culag for two nights whilst attending a family wedding in Luss.
reviews.title: A gem which won't break the bank

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cannot recommend this place highly enough. Stunning location, relaxed and friendly. I have never been quite so relaxed in a place. If you love being by water, you cannot get better than this. Sit outside for a while and listen to the loch gently lapping at the slate shore.
reviews.title: Glorious location, happy, friendly and idyllic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: On driving home today I spotted various B&B's and just thought, nope, they have nothing on the Culag. I've been in boutique hotels that offer supreme facilities, but nothing can take from the warmth of the Culag. Patrick the host is welcoming, friendly and cannot do enough to assist you in your stay or adventures out into the countryside.
reviews.title: gorgeous, well appointed, rural delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I note a review about the car noise, yes, it is off the main road that runs the length of the West side of the Loch - but I didn't find that much of a chore to be honest. I certainly slept well and comfortably.
reviews.title: Good price quality but road noise is a potential issue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were fortunate to be in the main house in room 2, with quite the most breathtaking view down the loch. My Mum was with us again in the main house in room 1 on the ground floor, her view was just as good, and she was delighted to sit at her window with her glass of wine as the sun set. Oh yes and we had exclusive use of the little sitting room on the ground floor too, which was just lovely to relax in both evenings. I giggled at the age of the TV, but I found it charming. I wasn't here to sit and watch TV. I had the most glorious Loch in the world to gaze at, and I could have done that for hours.
reviews.title: Still The best there is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the money this place is great, and I have to say Patrick is a supreme host. Last night he came to have a chat with myself my boyfriend and my Mum. Kindly too bringing my boyfriend a couple of Guinness to relax with. You don't get that sort of care just anywhere.
reviews.title: Beautiful location

aka: Culag Lochside Guest House Hotel Luss
